Hemoglobin.explanation: Protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen throughout the body
Hemoglobin.high_meaning: May indicate dehydration, smoking, living at high altitude, or polycythemia
Hemoglobin.low_meaning: May indicate anemia, blood loss, iron or vitamin deficiency

WBC.explanation: White blood cells that fight infections and foreign substances
WBC.high_meaning: May indicate infection, inflammation, stress, or leukemia
WBC.low_meaning: May indicate weak immune system, bone marrow problem, or certain medications

RBC.explanation: Red blood cells that carry hemoglobin and oxygen
RBC.low_meaning: May indicate anemia or blood loss

Platelet.explanation: Cells that help blood clot when you are injured
Platelet.high_meaning: May indicate inflammation, iron deficiency, or bone marrow overactivity
Platelet.low_meaning: May indicate increased bleeding risk, dengue, or certain medications

FBS.explanation: Blood sugar level measured after fasting overnight (8+ hours)
FBS.low_meaning: May cause dizziness, shakiness, or fainting (hypoglycemia)

HbA1c.explanation: Average blood sugar level over the past 2-3 months
HbA1c.low_meaning: Very low levels may indicate excessive insulin or certain blood disorders

SGPT.explanation: Liver enzyme (ALT) that increases when liver cells are damaged
SGPT.high_meaning: May indicate fatty liver, hepatitis, alcohol damage, or medication side effects

SGOT.explanation: Enzyme (AST) found in liver and heart; rises with damage to these organs
SGOT.high_meaning: May indicate liver disease, heart attack, or muscle damage

Cholesterol.explanation: Total fat content in the blood; too much can clog arteries
Cholesterol.high_meaning: Increases risk of heart attack and stroke
Cholesterol.low_meaning: Very low cholesterol is rare but may need evaluation

LDL.explanation: Bad cholesterol that builds up in arteries and causes blockages
LDL.high_meaning: High LDL significantly increases heart attack risk
LDL.low_meaning: Low LDL is generally good and protective

HDL.explanation: Good cholesterol that removes bad cholesterol from arteries
HDL.high_meaning: High HDL is protective against heart disease
HDL.low_meaning: Low HDL increases risk of heart disease

Triglycerides.explanation: Type of fat stored in the body; elevated levels indicate high cardiovascular risk
Triglycerides.high_meaning: May indicate diabetes risk, fatty liver, or poor diet

Creatinine.explanation: Waste product filtered by kidneys; elevated levels indicate reduced kidney function
Creatinine.high_meaning: Kidneys may not be filtering blood properly
Creatinine.low_meaning: May indicate low muscle mass, usually not concerning

TSH.explanation: Hormone that controls thyroid gland function and metabolism
TSH.high_meaning: Thyroid is underactive (hypothyroidism) - causes fatigue, weight gain
TSH.low_meaning: Thyroid is overactive (hyperthyroidism) - causes weight loss, anxiety

Sodium.explanation: Essential electrolyte that controls fluid balance and nerve function

Potassium.explanation: Essential electrolyte for heart and muscle function
Potassium.high_meaning: Can cause dangerous heart rhythm problems
Potassium.low_meaning: Can cause muscle weakness and heart rhythm issues
